definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

(main) hall/large room for a specific purpose/CL:間|间[jian1]/relationship between cousins etc on the paternal side of a family/of the same clan/classifier for classes, lectures etc/classifier for sets of furniture

sentences.english: There is a long table with a lot of food on it.
sentences.chinese: He一個大禮堂是一個有很多食品上長桌上。

sentences.english: Harry avoided his yellowish eyes as they scanned the Hall;
sentences.chinese: 他用那雙黃眼睛掃視着禮堂，哈利避開了他的目光。

sentences.english: They queued patiently to get into the auditorium.
sentences.chinese: 他們耐心地排隊進入禮堂。

sentences.english: This hall is big enough for a thousand people.
Entering the hall, I found all the seats occupied.
sentences.chinese: 我走進禮堂，發現全部座位都被佔了。

sentences.english: Students and faculty crowded every inch of the auditorium .
sentences.chinese: 學生和教職員把大禮堂擠得水泄不通。

sentences.english: On the first day, all of the new students attended an assembly in the school hall.
sentences.chinese: 開學第一天，所有的新生都去學校禮堂參加晨會。

sentences.english: Here, there's an analogy between the music hall and the theater of war.
sentences.chinese: 這裏在音樂禮堂與戰爭電影間有一種類比。

sentences.english: Students are congregated in the auditorium .
Lao Sun suddenly slipped out of the hall.
sentences.chinese: 老孫突然從禮堂溜了出來。

sentences.english: There is a hall and a beautiful garden on the ground floor.
sentences.chinese: 在底樓有一個禮堂和一個美麗的花園。

sentences.english: A young boy performs at an auditorium in the Special Economic Zone of Rason city.
sentences.chinese: 一個小男孩在羅津特別經濟特區的一個禮堂表演。

sentences.english: Later, people built the Poetry and Etiquette Hall near Confucius Former Residence.
sentences.chinese: 後世在孔子故宅旁建詩禮堂。

sentences.english: All the students were asked to assemble in the main hall.
sentences.chinese: 全體學生獲通知到大禮堂集合。

definition: meeting place/place where people gather/CL:個|个[ge4]
Fu Jen Catholic University of Peking (from 1925), forerunner of Beijing Normal University 北京師範大學|北京师范大学/Fu Jen Catholic University in New Taipei City, Taiwan
